intro: Boerlagiodendron kotoense, commonly known as the Koto endemic tree, is a rare species native to the island of Flores in Indonesia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves with a smooth surface. The plant produces yellowish-green flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native region.
